text:
e="preserve">James Carmichael Renick (December 8, 1948 – January 3, 2021) was an American academic. He was the Chancellor of University of Michigan–Dearborn from 1993 to 1999 and of North Carolina A&T State University from 1999 to 2006. He was born in Rockford, Illinois.
Renick died on January 3, 2021 in Greensboro, North Carolina from problems caused by amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, aged 72.
